definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: In Shenzhen, thousands of protesters called for a boycott of Japanese goods.
sentences.chinese: 在深圳，成千上萬的抗議者號召抵制日貨。
他們正在聯合抵制日貨。

sentences.english: Is it right to boycott Japanese products?
Why Chinese people boycott Japanese products?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼中國人會抵制日貨？

sentences.english: Japanese invasions after wave of young students set off a boycott of Japanese goods.
sentences.chinese: 日寇侵華後青年學生掀起抵制日貨風潮。

definition: flip-top (mobile phone, handbag etc)/to rebuild/to renovate
Diaoyu Islands, claimed by China but controlled by Japan as the Senkaku Islands, also called the Pinnacle Islands
open shelves (in self-service store or user access library)
Ministry of Railways (MOR), disbanded in 2013 with its regulatory functions taken over by the Ministry of Transport 交通運輸部|交通运输部[Jiao1 tong1 Yun4 shu1 bu4]
as far as I know/to the best of my knowledge
to visit a prostitute/(literary) to buy wine or drinks
Fengze district of Quanzhou city 泉州市[Quan2 zhou1 shi4], Fujian
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
